Bathing.value: Bathing: washing oneself by sponge bath; or in either a tub or shower, including the task of getting into or out of the tub or shower.

Continence.value: Continence: the ability to maintain control of bowel and bladder function; or, when unable to maintain control of bowel or bladder function, the ability to perform associated personal hygiene (including caring for catheter or colostomy bag).

Dressing.value: Dressing: putting on and taking off all items of clothing and any necessary braces, fasteners, or artificial limbs.

Eating.value: Eating: feeding oneself by getting food into the body from a receptacle (such as a plate, cup or table) or by a feeding tube or intravenously.

Toileting.value: Toileting: getting to and from the toilet, getting on and off the toilet, and performing associated personal hygiene.

Transferring.value: Transferring: moving into or out of a bed, chair, or wheelchair.

Nursing Home.value:
Nursing Home is a facility or a distinctly separate part of a hospital or other institution which:
• is licensed by the appropriate licensing agency to engage primarily in providing nursing care and related services to inpatients; and
• provides 24-hour a day nursing service; and
• has a nurse on duty or on call at all times; and
• maintains clinical records for all patients.

Nursing Home does not include:
• facilities or parts thereof used or licensed as an Assisted Living Facility; or
• convalescent homes, board and rest homes, homes for the aged, residential care facilities, domiciliary and retirement care facilities, or training centers; or
• government or veterans facilities or any other facility where the patient is not required to pay.

Adult Day Care.value: Adult Day Care is a program of services provided through an Adult Day Care Center that includes:

ELIMINATION_PERIOD_DETAIL.snippet: Your Elimination Period must be satisfied before we will pay you benefits, unless otherwise noted. Your Elimination Period is the number of days on which you: • meet the requirements defined in the Eligibility for Benefits provision; and • are receiving either Nursing Home Care, or if you have coverage under this Policy for Home and Community Services, are receiving Home and Community Services; and • are not receiving benefits under this Policy. Your Elimination Period is shown on the Benefit Schedule. Each day of covered services under this Policy, unless otherwise noted, counts towards your Elimination Period. Once you have satisfied the Elimination Period, no future Elimination Period is required. Days may be accumulated under separate claims in order to satisfy the Elimination Period. The Elimination Period applies to each insured individually in the case of joint coverage.

EXTENSION_OF_BENEFITS_DETAIL.snippet: Termination of this Policy will not terminate any benefits payable for Facility Care if your confinement begins while your Policy is in force and continues without interruption after the Policy terminates. Any benefits payable under this provision are subject to: the Benefit Amount; any applicable Elimination Period; and all other provisions and limitations of this Policy.

WAIVER_OF_PREMIUM_DETAIL.snippet: After you (either insured for joint coverage) have been confined in a Nursing Home or an Assisted Living Facility for a period of 90 days, and you meet the requirements in the Eligibility for Benefits provision, no premiums will be due following the 90th day. The 90 days need not be consecutive, but must be satisfied during a single claim period. Premiums already paid but no longer due will be refunded to you on a pro-rata basis. Premiums will again be due after your confinement ends. Any subsequent confinement separated by a period of at least 180 consecutive days will be considered a new claim period, subject to a new 90 day waiting period as described above.

BATHING.snippet: Bathing: washing oneself by sponge bath; or in either a tub or shower, including the task of getting into or out of the tub or shower.

CONTINENCE.snippet: Continence: the ability to maintain control of bowel and bladder function; or, when unable to maintain control of bowel or bladder function, the ability to perform associated personal hygiene (including caring for catheter or colostomy bag).

DRESSING.snippet: Dressing: putting on and taking off all items of clothing and any necessary braces, fasteners, or artificial limbs.

EATING.snippet: Eating: feeding oneself by getting food into the body from a receptacle (such as a plate, cup or table) or by a feeding tube or intravenously.

TOILETING.snippet: Toileting: getting to and from the toilet, getting on and off the toilet, and performing associated personal hygiene.

TRANSFERRING.snippet: Transferring: moving into or out of a bed, chair, or wheelchair.

ADULT_DAY_CARE.snippet: Adult Day Care is a program of services provided through an Adult Day Care Center that includes:

ADULT_DAY_CARE_BULLETS.snippet: care for six (6) or more individuals; and health-related services; and Maintenance or Personal Care Services; and recreational and social services provided during the day in a community group setting.

Nursing Home is a facility or a distinctly separate part of a hospital or other institution which:
• is licensed by the appropriate licensing agency to engage primarily in providing nursing care and related services to inpatients; and
• provides 24-hour a day nursing service; and
• has a nurse on duty or on call at all times; and

Nursing Home does not include:

• convalescent homes, board and rest homes, homes for the aged, residential care facilities, domiciliary and retirement care facilities, or training centers; or

reasoningNotes: No Azure Search snippets were available; all populated values and snippets come from the provided extraction JSON.

Some populated values (e.g. '8', '12', '14') are numeric page references from the 'GUIDE TO YOUR POLICY' table of contents mapping to detailed sections elsewhere in the document. I preserved the skeleton numeric entries and included the detailed paragraph sources where available to provide context.
ADL definitions were extracted from the 'DEFINITIONS' section (page 3) and populated with moderate confidence (0.6) because OCR confidence on those lines was lower.

Elimination Period, Extension of Benefits, and Waiver of Premium were populated per the skeleton using the extraction field IDs from the table of contents (page 2) and supplemented with the detailed section text (pages 7, 11, and 13 respectively) to support those values.
Fields without explicit evidence in the extraction JSON were left null per instructions and not fabricated.
I preserved the provided skeleton values and confidences unless stronger evidence in the extraction JSON required changing them (none did).
